intro: Mammillaria calleana, commonly known as the Calleana mammillaria, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems that are often covered with white, woolly spines. The plant produces small, yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its compact size and ornamental appearance, it is often cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and collections.
